amendment.description: Amendment increases and decreases funding by $1,000,000 to propose a study to examine how HHS can facilitate ways to include programs for social determinants of health under the same roof as traditional health services, and estimate what amount of additional funding might be required.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 43 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase and decrease by $1,000,000 to propose a study to examine how HHS can facilitate ways to include programs for social determinants of health under the same roof as traditional health services, and estimate what amount of additional funding might be required.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Keating amendment (A041) Agreed to by recorded vote: 283 - 141 (Roll no. 290).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Keating amendment (A041) Agreed to by recorded vote: 283 - 141 (Roll no. 290).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A041) offered by Mr. Keating.
